commitResults.messageBody: from @ian-from-dover

commitResults.messageTitle: Make Job and Money classes more robust and flexible
commitResults.messageBody:
Instead of specifying a fixed per-hour rate, we specify a `Rate`, which
allows us to better describe pay rates (e.g. $20 per 4 hours, etc).

We use `Duration`s instead of `float`s for durations in `Job`s to avoid
floating point imprecision.

We also avoid the use of float operations in `Money` to force users of
the `Money` class to specify precise values (i.e. with BigDecimal).

Finally, we also add a (hopefully unique) job ID to `Job` instances, so
we can uniquely identify jobs with only the ID (since it's plausible
that there might be multiple jobs with the exact same attributes).

commitResults.messageTitle: Make deserializers more uniform and understandable
commitResults.messageBody:
Basically, we try to standardize how we deserialize Jackson nodes, and
what we name the err msg variables (or something, I guess)

We also add new checks for the node type -- slightly more important when
deserializing types that we didn't write (eg `Set`, `List`) so that we
can throw our own exceptions with our own messages

commitResults.messageTitle: Add extra `serializePerson` method for new tests
commitResults.messageBody:
(In `PersonUtil`)

Previous methods only took a `Set<String>` (to be serialized into a JSON
array of strings) for the tags.

This new method also takes a `String` as the raw representation of the
`tagged` value so that we can test serialization of invalid `Person`
serializers where the value of the `tagged` field is not a JSON array.

commitResults.messageBody:
Remove traces of AB3 in config.yml. Update index.md to match
README.md.
Job is an abstraction of jobs that people can take.

Money is an abstraction for money that uses BigDecimal to format its
values. It contains some arithmetic methods.
Money.java: Changed currency locale to Locale.US to get '$'.
Job.java: Error with implementation of setAsNotPaid() method.

Job.java: Renamed isPaid to hasPaid.
Money.java: Removed unnecessary methods calls on double constructor.
Added additional comments for equals.
JobTest.java: Renamed isPaid to hasPaid

commitResults.messageTitle: ï»¿Update AB3 model to handle jobs
commitResults.messageBody:
Updated AddressBook and Model (and associated interfaces) to be able
to handle jobs. Provides a framework for future job manipulation
through commands or UI components. Awaiting final job list
implementation before finalizing on details. Tests have also not
been added for the changes for the same reason. Framework should be
sufficient for current needs.

Currently adds the following commands:
JobAddCommand: Adding a job
JobDeleteCommand: Deletes a job
JobListCommand: Lists all jobs (in the console)
JobMarkCommand: Marks a job as paid or unpaid
JobAssignCommand: Assigns a job to a person

Issues needing resolution/follow-up:
Implement UI to display jobs
Serdes of joblist
Serdes of employment (job-person association)
JobIdFactory does not consider job IDs of serialized jobs
Testing of JobAddCommand since job IDs are non-deterministic
More in-depth test cases for commands

commitResults.messageTitle: Add serdes to employment and jobs
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- Add serializers and deserializers to handle jobs and employment
- Updated format of JobAddCommand.java and JobAssignCommand.java
- Allow job IDs created from JobIdFactory to be unique
- Updated AddressBook.java to handle deserialized instances
- Rename JobListManager.java to UniqueJobList.java
- Removed set of persons in Job.java

Unresolved:
- Automated testing for all commands
- Potentially non-deterministic serdes tests for AddressBook
- Only displaying job command results to result display in UI
- Potential implementation improvements (see TODOs in code)

commitResults.messageBody:
`JobAssignCommand` now uses indexes and can handle multiple values.
Added `hashCode` to `Index` for `equals`.
Updated automated testing related to `JobAssignCommand`.
Updated `ParserUtil` and associated tests.
Also updated associated tests.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add `JobFindCommand` and related classes and tests
commitResults.messageBody: Allows the user to filter through the `Job` list.

Updated `JobAddCommand` to not use `Rate`.
Removed uses of `calculateRate()` (`UI` and `Exporter`).
Changed `Job` constructor and added `isFinal` field.
`PaymentHandler` does all the coupling work.

Use `pay INDEX y/`, the `y/` is for confirmation.
`JobFinalizeCommand` is supposed to be irreversible, no `Job`
related functions are allowed to act on a finalized `Job`.
This does not stop malicious/error-prone users from modifying the
data file and affecting finalized `Job`s.
The only command that affects finalized `Job`s is `clear`.

From preliminary testing, all features seem to be in good working
order.
Automated testing for `Job` related command on finalized `Job`s not
yet added.
`Rate` was removed from `Job` so `UI` requires the changes to remove
the placeholder `Rate` values.
In removing `Rate` from `Job`, small changes had to be made to
`Exporter`, requires some attention.
Also refactored classes to the `model.money` package.
